channel.title: Vietnam – StefanCarlton.net
channel.description: my little place on the web

item.title: Vietnam has a sizeable chip on it’s shoulder
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: The way Vietnam portrays itself is baffling. Rich and poor share the same street. People are brainwashed and museums tell lies. It such a surreal place to experience!

item.title: Vietnam has a tourism problem
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: Vietnam is an odd ball. Part of me highly recommends some places, but overall I can’t say I enjoyed traveling there nor would suggest others come here. I’m still trying to work out what is wrong though!

item.title: Ho Chi Minh City – it’s a little bit boring
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: My last destination in Vietnam was Ho Chi Minh City – it’s nothing special really. Not much to be said either.

item.title: The Vietnamese beach haunt of Vung Tau
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: If Nha Trang and Mui Ne are the beach resort of choice for the Western Tourist, then Vung Tau is the place the Vietnamese go. It’s not the nicest beach, nor does it have great food, but it’s awesome all the same.

item.title: Cu Chi Tunnels
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: A lot of tourism in Vietnam focuses on the Vietnam war, it’s hard to get away from and you are constantly reminded of it. Here, in Cu Chi, you get to see a little more of the VietCong lifestyle and be subjected to the propaganda machine in full flow.

item.title: Mui Ne – just a kite surfing beach
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: Mui Ne was next after Nha Trang and it was meant to be a better beach town, slightly less night-life, lots of things to see including amazing sand dunes. For me though it didn’t work out that way though.

item.title: Nha Trang Mud baths
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: Nha Trang is a party place on the Vietnamese coast, most of it’s draw is the sunny weather and the party atmosphere but this is lacking in the constant rain of the Winter – there is still fun to be had though!

item.title: Another Party Cruise, Nha Trang
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: This was a second attempt at the “party cruise”, the first having ended in disaster in Halong Bay. I have to say it was a complete success and everywhere the Halong Bay Cruise failed, the one in Nha Trang succeeded.

item.title: Hoi An – Its all about the Cakes and Coffee
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: After the horrendous stay in Hue, Hoi An was a breath of fresh air. The tourist lined streets, the respectful locals, the nice buildings, the relaxing atmosphere and the company of two great people. Hoi An was perfect.

item.title: Huế is a terrible place to be
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: Hue is a fairly historically important city in Vietnam acting as the capital at one point but also given it’s proximity to the North, South DMZ was home to one of the more important battles in the Vietnam War so it should be interesting. The problem is, it’s a horrid place and in my experience should be avoided at all costs.
